blocks.text: How to answer “type vs category” questions

Many exam questions describe a control and ask for the BEST classification. Use two passes: decide the type (prevent/deter/detect/correct/compensate/direct), then decide the category (technical/managerial/operational/physical).

items: Login banner on an application → deterrent control + technical control.
Policy stating data misuse may lead to termination → deterrent control + managerial control.
Reception desk greeting/monitoring visitors → deterrent control + operational control.
Warning signs posted on a perimeter fence → deterrent control + physical control.
Daily review of authentication reports → detective control + managerial control.
Guard patrols checking the property → detective control + operational control.
Restore a system from backup after ransomware → corrective control + technical control.
Call authorities after a physical break-in → corrective control + operational control.

blocks.text: Compensating controls often show up as “we can’t do the ideal fix yet.” Example: a vendor patch is delayed, so you apply segmentation or a firewall block as a compensating control.
